title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 16ยง 166.2 - Records
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 16ยง 166.2 - Records

State Regulations

The books and records referred to in this section include
not only accounting records in a limited technical sense, but all other
records, such as minute books, stock books, reports, correspondence, memoranda, etc., which may be useful in developing the history of, or facts regarding, any
transaction. All such records in the system of accounts discussed in Part 167
of this Title shall be accessible, at all times, to the authorized
representatives of the commission at a location within the State of New York, unless the company is specifically exempted by order of this
commission. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 16ยง
166.2

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
